alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:19PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Yuma and northern Kit Carson Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 618 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles south of Yuma to 6 miles east of Cope to 12 miles southeast of Thurman. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bonny Reservoir around 700 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Joes, Hale and Abarr. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 194 and 244. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
